feed.title: SAP Community - Document Information Extraction
feed.subtitle: Document Information Extraction Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Schema in Document Information Extraction for Create Sales Order - Automatic Extraction (4X9)
entry.content:
I have set up scope item 4X9 Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction in my S/4HANA 2023 Private Cloud environment. When uploading the purchase order PDF, there are corrections I would like to make that I have actioned in the Document Information Extraction application on BTP. I have corrected the fields, associated the document with the template, and assigned the template to schema SAP_purchaseOrder_schema.

When I upload the PDF in the Document Information Extraction UI, I can select this schema and the template is applied correctly. 

However, when using the UI in S/4HANA, in this case the "Create Sales Order - Automatic Extraction" fiori app, the document shows up in Document Information Extraction UI but it shows the message

"Schema associated with this document has been deleted."

Is this expected behaviour? Is it possible to associate this app "Create Sales Order - Automatic Extraction" (Scope item 4X9) with a particular schema for Purchase Orders? Or perhaps change the association in Document Information Extraction to use the schema SAP_purchaseOrder_schema when the inbound document is a Purchase Order, which is correctly identified in the header.

The plan I have selected in BTP for Document Information Extraction is the basic plan, not the premium plan.

Any guidance is much appreciated.

entry.title: Search Documents and ECNs that is linked to a Material using a table in SE16N
entry.content:
Hello, I would like to know how to search for Documents (DIRs) and Change Master Record (ECNs) that is linked to a Material using any table in SE16N or database.

I know the basic search transaction 'Find Documents'.

In my case, I have a huge number of MAT numbers. Using this, I need to know what all DIRs and ECNs are linked to them.

If someone could share the info, very much appreciated for your support and knowledge.

entry.title: Reading Vehicle Licence Plate (Vehicle Number Plate) Using Document Information Extraction
entry.content:
I am working on a project where I am using Document Information Extraction technology to extract text from vehicle number plates. This technology helps recognize and pull out the alphanumeric characters (text) displayed on number plates. However, I am facing challenges when it comes to extracting the color of the number plate. While the text extraction is not working properly and the color detection part isn't being detected, and the results are not accurate. I need help to improve this process so that I can reliably capture both the text (numbers and letters) and the color of the number plate from images.

I am looking for advice, suggestions, or best practices that could help resolve this issue and make the system work more efficiently.

Specifically, I want to ensure that both the text and color extraction happen smoothly and accurately in my project.
@tomasz_janasz @MariaGoepfert 

SAP Document AI

entry.title: Delete Document via API on Document Information Extraction
entry.content:
Hello,

I found the section ‚ÄúDelete Document‚Äù in the documentation for the API: https://help.sap.com/docs/document-information-extraction/document-information-extraction/delete-document

There it is written that a single document can be deleted if the ID of the document is given:

Unfortunately, this does not work for me as described in the documentation. In my case, all documents are always deleted despite IDs being specified, but I don't want that.

This is what my Api call looks like:

Have I made a mistake?
Especially concerning the payload...

Does anyone here have the same problem or is the problem known?

Thanks for your help

entry.title: Cds Documentation
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
I am unable to find the documentation for the following CDS views in the S/4HANA 1809 section:

I_PurchaseOrder
I_PurchaseOrderItem
I_Supplier
I_Customer
I_Product
I_Stock
I_Material
I_Movement
I_ProfitCenter
I_GLAccountLineItem
I_SalesAnalysis
I_Project
I_ProjectNetwork
I_SalesCondition

If I check the CDS views at this link, not all the standard CDS views are documented like the ones mentioned above
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/ee6ff9b281d8448f96b4fe6c89f2bdc8/8573b810511948c8a99c0672abc159aa.html?locale=en-US&version=1809.latest

Does anyone know how to perform a more in-depth search or where I can find official documentation for these views?

Thank you!

entry.title: Document Information Extraction - XML File Support - Error E30
entry.content:
Hello everyone, 

I am trying to process XML Invoices via SAP Document AI. According to the documentation, filetype XML is supposed to be supported for invoices. When trying to upload XML Files via the Web-UI, an Error-Message is shown, describing "Error: Files of this filetype can not be processed (Code: E30).

After further inspecting the network traffic, HTTP RC 415 - Unsupported Media Type is returned for Content type text/xml.
Can somebody assist here? Already tried multiple different Instances & XML Files. 

Thanks!

entry.title: Detecting Handwritten vs. Digital Docs in SAP CAP + DOX
entry.content: I'm working on a solution using SAP CAP (Cloud Application Programming) with Node.js, integrated with SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX). This project sends documents via API to the DOX service to extract relevant information from files such as invoices and receipts. My requirement here is to check whether the document is handwritten or computer-generated. This distinction could significantly enhance data accuracy and processing logic. If anyone has insights on integrating handwriting detection with SAP DOX or using pre-processing techniques for document classification, I‚Äôd love to connect and learn more.

entry.title: How to upload documents in bulk using a background job - Document information Extraction
entry.content:
hi guys,

Could you let me know if there's an option to upload documents to Document Information Extraction via a batch job or another tool/program, in a more automated way than uploading document by document manually by a user? And if yes, how to achieve this?

I have a case where I will receive hundreds of scanned documents every day (purchase orders) in a specific folder, from which a job or program should pick them up one by one and try to upload them to Document Information Extraction (DIE).

best,

Ewa

entry.title: Table change not possible. There is a db trigger on the table
entry.content:
"Table change not possible. There is a DB trigger on the table." I am facing this issue; how to solve this?

 

‚ÄÉ

entry.title: Oppt Prioritization score custom Agent in SAP CX AI Toolkit
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to create a custom AI agent for opportunities called Oppt Prioritization score agent. For this i created an AI Tool by giving the following prompt:

You are an opportunity prioritization agent in the SAP CX AI Toolkit for SAP Sales Cloud V2. Analyze all opportunities with Opprtunity.Status with Open status.

Calculate the prioritization score based on the following weighted criteria:
1. Opportunity.Expected_Value (50% weight)
2. Opportunity.Probability (30% weight)
3. Opportunity.Close_Date within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date (20% weight)
Assumptions
4.Opportunity.Probability is assumed to be a percentage (0-100).
5.The Opportunity.Close_Date condition is binary, based on whether it falls within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date, interpreted as future dates for prioritization.

Priotitization Score = 0.5*{Opportunity.Expected_Value} + 0.3*{Opportunity.Probability} + 0.2*{cases}
1 {ifOpportunity.Close_Date is within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date} else
0
end{cases}

Provide a one-sentence explanation per opportunity justifying its ranking and, sorted by Amount (descending). Use a professional tone and avoid technical jargon.
For each opportunity, provide a brief, actionable follow-up recommendation (e.g., ‚ÄúSchedule a discovery call to discuss budget constraints‚Äù). Use a concise, professional tone and leverage intelligent Q&A to ensure recommendations are contextually relevant.
Include a summary of recent interactions for each opportunity, generated using the toolkit‚Äôs AI summary capabilities. Use a professional tone and ensure recommendations support team collaboration.
Ensure Output Fits Within 5000 Chatacters
Compact Formatting--> Remove unnecessary spaces & line breaks.
Limit Answer Length--> Max 500 Characters per answer, truncate with "..."

I assigned this AI tool to the custom AI Agent.The details (PFA screenshot) which are used are

Expected value = 15000 USD

Probability = 80

Close Date = 25 Jul 2025

The calculation for close date is incorrect, it should be 1, but it is coming as 0. Any suggestions how can i achieve the condition for the close date?

entry.title: SAP Business Process Automation with Document Information Extraction - extract data using AI
entry.content:
Greetings,

I am building a automation process and want to use the activity "Extract Data Using AI (Premium), reference can be found here IRPA SDK V2.

It is marked as Alpha, so I'm not sure what that means. I am using Document Information Extraction SDK version 1.75.21 (the latest) but this activity is not available within the SDK. 

Can you please let me know when it will be available as it is key to the process I am building. As we have many document types I do not want to extract based on a template. We do have DOX premium service to allow for gen AI extraction based on the schema only.

Many thanks in advance for your help, Adrian

entry.title: "message": "Missing parameter: options" in SAP Document AI Upload API
entry.content:
Hi Team,

While working with the document upload api (below) in SAP document AI API from BAS 

../document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs getting the error in network response -
{
"error": {
"code": "E95",
"message": "Required form-data not provided.",
"details": [
{
"code": "0",
"message": "Missing parameter: options"
}
]
}
}
while the same is working fine from Postman

Any help is greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance.

SAP Document AI

entry.title: Is it possible to structure DOX files in folders and subfolders?
entry.content:
Hi 

When we load documents via the DOX web UI or via API endpoint, the documents are just places in one big unstructured stack and the UI seems to have no option to structure these files and even not very good search functionality. 

I have below test setup with currently only 3 documents, but when wh go live I expect we will have maybe hundreds of documents loaded every day and the documents will be for different solutions like purchase order, sales invoices, and some custom made documents for certificates. 
It is not nice that these documents are just in a big stack and I can't even filter on template or schema.

Or can I? Are there some tools that I didn't see?


Kind Regards
Thomas Madsen Nielsen

entry.title: Customizing Extraction Fields in SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX)
entry.content:
Hello, 

I‚Äôm currently evaluating SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX) in SAP Document AI using a trial account. Although I‚Äôve noticed that it extracts every text very accurately, not every text is being mapped to the extraction fields.
 
I wanted to add/customize header fields myself to map the extracted text to header fields or line items better (while following this link https://help.sap.com/docs/document-ai/sap-document-ai/add-data-fields to add data fields) but schema configuration doesn‚Äôt appear in my trial environment. It also states that I cannot change SAP schemas as shown in the attached image below:

So I was wondering if it's possible to edit/customize extraction fields in the premium version of SAP Document AI? If so, does this customization occur before the optical character recognition (OCR) to guide the model, or only after OCR to map extracted text to fields?
 
Defining custom field mappings before OCR would be extremely valuable for my team's use case, so I‚Äôd greatly appreciate if anyone can explain what‚Äôs possible before I consider upgrading to a full subscription. Thank you.

entry.title: How do I make DOX learn?
entry.content:
Hi 

I trying to load some purchase orders with different layouts. I Need to extract at least one field that is not included in the SAP standard schema (EAN no.), so I made a copy of the SAP_purchaseOrder_schema and added the ean header field to the copy.

The new field can have setup type Manual or Auto (with a default extractor). As I understand the documentation, a custom field must have setup type Manual. Also I understand that only setup type Auto will use the AI functionality and if I chose Manual setup type, I must make a template. Does this mean that fields with Auto are handled by the AI and fields with Manual are depending on the template?

So I have made the new field with setup type Manual and I have made a template.

Then I uploaded a file. Some data was extracted wrongly so I entered Edit mode and corrected the errors and saved the document again. Then I addet the document to the template.

Now I expected DOX to have learned from the corrections I made, but if I load exactly same document again, it still makes the same errors.

So, can anyone explain how DOX can learn and what setup influence the learning and what I can to to teach DOX?

Also I would like to understand, if I have 3 purchase orders with 3 very different layouts, can I handle this by adding the 3 documents to one template or must I create 3 templates or is it even better to create 3 different schemas?

I hope it is allright that I asked 3 questions in this thread as I think they are all related to the subject - how does DOX learn and fix extraction errors?

Kind Regards 
Thomas Madsen Nielsen

entry.title: The limited no of documents in the Trial version of SAP Document AI must increase to make sense
entry.content:
Hi 

Depending on where you read documentation, the limited no of document that can be loaded in a Trial DOX is either 30 or 50 documents per month - with the addition that it counts one document per every 3 pages in a file.

This very little - almost useless. On top of this the usage statistics in BTP are unreliable, so the counted usage is higher than reality.

I have a BTP trial account with a trial DOX where I have loaded 17 document. 7 in August and 10 in September, but the usage statistics says I have loaded 40 documents in September and now my quota is used. I know 100% sure I loaded the same document 10 times in september and the document was only 2 pages, so it should count 10 documents instead of 40.

Also it is frustrating that the usage statistics says I loaded 47 documents, but even if that was correct (it isn't), the documentation says that the quota is 50 documents per 30 days (rolling period), so according to documentation my quota is not used in any way.

 


If SAP wants to sell SAP Document AI, they should increase the quota. If we can't really test it, why should we buy it?

Also I find it disturbing that the usage statistics count usage that does not exist. I have seen this problem not only in trail versions, but also in Pay-As-You-Go.

Just my 2 cents.

Thomas Madsen Nielsen

entry.title: How to Integrate SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Perfect üëç Here‚Äôs your full rephrased + enhanced message including the part about creating an Action for file upload. You can use this directly in your SAP Community or Blog:

I have created an instance of SAP Document AI and built a few custom schemas to read PDFs. Everything works fine when tested directly in Document AI.

Now, I want to integrate it with SAP Build Process Automation (BPA). For this, I have already created a destination.

My question:
üëâ How can I create an Action in BPA to upload a file to Document AI?

  • Do we need to use a Custom Script to achieve this, or is it recommended to only create Actions in BPA and then call them in a process?

If the recommended approach is to use an Action, can someone guide me on how to create an Action in BPA for file upload?

Specifically:

  • How should the input parameters (like PDF file and options JSON) be defined in the Action?

  • How do we configure the multipart/form-data request inside the Action?

  • Once created, can this Action be directly reused in different BPA processes for uploading files?

Would really appreciate your guidance. Thanks in advance!

For reference, below are the steps I followed in Postman which work successfully:

Step 1: Upload the PDF

Call the Upload API with multipart/form-data.

  • file ‚Üí PDF document

  • options ‚Üí JSON with schema details

Example:

{
  "schemaId": "69d84f47-b658-46fb-a330-d9aadd602112",
  "clientId": "default",
  "documentType": "invoice"
}

üëâ Response returns a Job ID.

Step 2: Check Job Status

Use the Get Job API with the Job ID.
Proceed when status = SUCCEEDED.

Step 3: Fetch Extracted Data

Call the Get Result API with the Job ID to get the extracted data in JSON format (header details, line items, etc.).

‚úÖ Now, I‚Äôm looking for help on how to configure this same upload flow as an Action in SAP BPA, so I can call it directly from an automation.

entry.title: SAP Document AI - item splitted to 2 pages
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

In SAP Document AI (Premium version), I run into a limitation when invoices or other documents contain line items that are split across two pages.

Instead of treating them as one item, the service always creates two separate items. I know this is a known limitation, but I‚Äôm trying to understand if there are any workarounds or configuration options that can help.

So far I‚Äôve tried:

  • Enabling Instant Learning

  • Setting dataFeedbackCollection = true

‚Ä¶but it doesn‚Äôt improve the results.

  • Has anyone found a reliable way to handle split line items?

  • Are there service settings or template tricks that help?

  • Or is post-processing/merging the only practical solution at this point?

Would love to hear how others are dealing with this.

Thank you

entry.title: Blog Post : Integrate SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation on a Trial Account
entry.content:
Introduction

In today's digital world, automating document-heavy processes is key to improving efficiency and accuracy. Manually extracting data from invoices, purchase orders, or delivery notes is time-consuming and prone to errors. This is where the powerful combination of SAP Document AI and SAP Build Process Automation comes into play.

SAP Document AI uses machine learning to intelligently extract structured data from unstructured documents. SAP Build Process Automation allows you to design, build, and run automated workflows. By integrating these two services, you can create robust automations that read, interpret, and process documents just like a human would, but faster and without fatigue.

In this blog post, we will walk through the steps to integrate these two services on a trial account, using a standard invoice schema to extract data.

Prerequisites

  • An active SAP BTP Trial Account.
  • Access to SAP Build Process Automation in your trial subaccount.
  • Basic familiarity with the SAP Build Process Automation studio.

Step 1: Subscribe to SAP Document AI

The easiest way to get started with SAP Document AI on SAP BTP is by using the booster tool.

  1. Log in to your SAP BTP Trial Account cockpit.
  2. Navigate to your Subaccount and go to the Booster.
  3. Search for "SAP Document AI" and click on Start.
  4. Run the booster. It will automatically:
    1. Subscribe you to the service.
    2. Create a service instance and a service key.
  5. Once the booster completes, go to your Subaccount -> Instances and Subscriptions.
  6. Find your newly created service instance for SAP Document AI and navigate to its Service Keys. Open the default service key.
  7. Crucial: From the JSON of the service key, note down the following values. You will need them in the next step:
    1. uaa.clientid
    2. uaa.clientsecret
    3. uaa.url
Note: To access the SAP Document AI service on the browser (e.g., to check schemas or test manually), ensure your user has the appropriate roles assigned by the booster, such as Document_Information_Extraction_Viewer.

Step 2: Generate an Access Token in your Automation

To call any SAP Document AI API, you need a valid OAuth access token. We will generate this using the client credentials from the service key.

  1. In your SAP Build Process Automation project, create three String variables:
    1. uaaUrl (Value: The uaa.url from your service key)
    2. clientId (Value: The uaa.clientid from your service key)
    3. clientSecret (Value: The uaa.clientsecret from your service key)
  2. Create a fourth variable to hold the combined client ID and secret, encoded in Base64. Name it clientInfo.
  3. Use a Script activity to construct the request for the access token. Set the Output parameter of this script to a variable of type Any (e.g., optionsGet).
    1. Script Code for Access Token Request:
return {
    method: 'GET',
    url: uaaUrl + '/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials',
    responseType: 'json', 
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    headers:{
        Authorization:'Basic ' + clientInfo
    }
};
  • After this script, use an Rest Call Web Service activity.
  • The response contains an access_token field. Extract this token into a new string variable or directly pass it to the variable. The value should be:
    1. "Bearer " + step2.obj.access_token

Step 3: Upload a Document for Processing

Now that we have an access token, we can upload an invoice document for processing. We will use the pre-built SAP_invoice_schema.

  1. Ensure you have the path to your invoice file stored in a variable (e.g., fileObj).
  2. Use another Script activity to construct the multipart/form-data request for document upload. The output will be your request configuration.
  3. Use an Rest Call Web Service activity to execute this request.
    1. Script Code for Document Upload:
// Define the extraction options
let optionsPayload = {
    documentType: "custom",
    schemaName: "SAP_invoice_schema", // Using the pre-built schema
    // Below commented values are optional, if you want you can use as per requirement.
    //headerFields: ["deliveryNoteNumber", "purchaseOrderNumber", "deliveryDate"],
    //lineItemFields: ["materialNumber", "quantity", "unitOfMeasure"],
    clientId: "default"
};

// Construct the HTTP request options
let requestOptions = {
    method: "POST",
    url: "https://aiservices-trial-dox.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs",
    responseType: "json",
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    metadataType: irpa_core.enums.request.metadataType.formData, // Crucial for file upload
    headers: {
        Authorization: access_Token // Use the variable from previous step
    },
    metadata: [
        {
            name: "file",
            file: fileObj, // Variable holding the file path
        },
        {
            name: "options",
            value: JSON.stringify(optionsPayload)
        }
    ],
    timeout: 30000 // Set a longer timeout for file upload
};

return requestOptions;‚Äã
  • From the uploadResponse, extract two crucial values:
    1. The job id (e.g., into jobId). You will need this to check the result.
    2. The initial status. It will be 'PENDING', meaning the AI is processing the document.

Step 4: Retrieve the Extracted Data

Processing with AI is not instantaneous. We need to poll the service until the status changes from PENDING to DONE.

  1. Create a Data Type: First, create a simple Data Type (e.g., ExtractionResult) with two fields:
    1. Status (Type: String)
    2. Data (Type: Any)
  2. Create a Variable: Create a variable (e.g., finalResult) of this custom type ExtractionResult.
  3. Set Initial Value: Initialize this variable. Set Status to 'PENDING' and leave Data blank.
  4. Build the Polling Request: Create a Script activity to build a GET request to check the job status. The output will be used in an HTTP Request.
    1. Script Code for Retrieving Job Status/Result:
let requestOptions = {
    method: "GET",
    // Use the jobId from the upload step in the URL
    url: "https://aiservices-trial-dox.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs/" + jobId,
    responseType: "json",
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    headers: {
        Authorization: access_Token, // Re-use the same access token
        'Cache-Control': 'no-cache'
    }
};
return requestOptions;‚Äã
  • Implement the Polling Loop:
    1. Drag a Forever Loop into your workflow.
    2. In the loop's Condition, use the expression: finalResult.Status !== 'PENDING'. This means the loop will break as soon as the status is no longer 'PENDING'.
    3. Inside the loop:
      1. Use a Wait activity (e.g., wait for 2 seconds) to avoid making too many API calls.
      2. Use the Rest Call Web Service activity with the configuration from the script above. Store the output in a temporary variable (e.g., pollResponse).
      3. Use a Set Variable activity to update finalResult.Status with pollResponse.status  with pollResponse.
    4. The loop will continue until the status in the API response changes to 'DONE'. Once it breaks out of the loop, finalResult.Data will contain the fully extracted invoice data!

You can now use the extracted data in the subsequent steps of your automation, such as filling a form or triggering another process.

The Flow will look like this:

Conclusion

Congratulations! You have successfully integrated SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation. You have built an automation that can submit documents for processing and patiently wait for the AI to return the extracted structured data. This pattern can be applied to countless use cases involving invoices, contracts, forms, and more, unlocking significant potential for automation within your business processes.

This is just the beginning. You can explore creating custom schemas tailored to your specific document types for even more precise extraction.

Feel free to connect here or on LinkedIn for any questions or suggestions.

LinkedIn : Indrajit Shah https://www.linkedin.com/in/indrajit-shahkumar/
LinkedIn : Aditi Jain https://www.linkedin.com/in/aditi-jain-3b6b4a190/
Co-Author @Aditii_Jain

entry.title: Question: When will my blog post become visible on SAP Community?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I submitted a blog post this past Sunday (October 5, 2025). As far as I know, blog posts on SAP Community go through a moderation process before being published.

How long does this usually take? My post hasn't been published yet.
Did I possibly miss something, or should I just wait a bit longer?

Thanks in advance üôè
